Reviews.Title: “Perfection! Definitely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: maria3405
Reviews.Content: Stay here! We couldn't have found a better place to stay (unless money was no object maybe) but even then I could have stayed here!Â  This place has the perfect mixture of charm, art, history, and modern amenities. All facilities including the garden entrance, lobby, bar, eating area, all lounging areas, and rooms have a modern feel. However, the building is quite old (I think the website says how old- I think 1500's) Â and some of the rooms still have the original design elements. There is also local art and sculptures displayed throughout the hotel.Â  The service is amazing and the front desk speaks English very well.Â  We stayed in the charming "dormer" room but I highly suggest a superior room or if you can, the junior suite. Â The " dormer" room is on the fifth floor and has a small set of stairs to climb. There were only about 10 steps total and you can take the elevator to the fourth floor. The bell man also carried our bags up for us. Â The room has low sloping ceilings and I don't recommend it for anyone over 5'10. Â It is great if you are looking for a quiet, cozy, and romantic setting though. Â The bed was very comfortable and I loved the smell of their linens.Â  The bathroom was all new and the shower could use more head room but overall, ok. The water could also have been hotter but I will admit I love my showers very hot. My husband said the water temperature would be fine for any normal person. :)Â  The breakfast was very good for a European breakfast including scrambled eggs, bacon, more Italian meats, three types of bread, cereal, yogurt, and of course any drink you wanted.Â  The location was perfect! If you are coming from the train, make a right out of the train station and buy tickets at the far right booth for the water bus (vaparetto/actv). Â You will get on black line, number one (also far right building) and get off at San Stae which is only two stops down. The water bus is the cheapest and best way. A water taxi will cost around 40 to 50 euros and the water bus is only about 7 euros.Â  Once your off at S. Stae, make a left to the small bridge ( you will see it immediately) make a right once over the bridge and then an immediate left and another left into the garden area. Very easy!Â  Venice is very touristy and the crowds near Rialto and San Marco unbearable sometimes but this hotel is far out enough that it is quiet but close enough to walk to all attractions. Â You don't even need a map to get to Rialto or San Marco either. The directions are on yellow signs on the buildings. Just make a right out of the hotel then a left and make a left into the first bigger plaza area you see (spiezle, I think). Â The restaurant Muro is here and is pretty good.Â  If we venture back to Venice again, we will definitely stay here again!! It was great and I highly recommend it!Â

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Bad Staff Recommendations”
Reviews.Author: SmarterTools I
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and beautiful. It is located next to one of the boat bus stops which Is convenient. Internet is $10 euros for the entire stay per device. The breakfast was included and had many options to choose from. The hotel staff is friendly but beware of the Murrano island Glass tour & tourist trap. The hotel staff encourages you to take a free boat taxi to the island of Murrano to watch glass be made. When you get there you watch how it is made for 10 minutes and are then put in a one on one high pressure sales situation. Guests are led to believe they will get a far superior product with all shipping and duties/taxes included in the very high prices of these items. We later learned this is not true, with previous customers complaining that they had been hit with huge shipping and duty/tax costs on delivery. After you are done with the tour and paperwork for whatever purchases made they ship you off the island so that you cannot see anything else on the island. This whole experience really soured our impression of Venice and the hotel for its recommendation. I would hope the hotel would stop this practice as it could ruin their reputation because it really is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: WdecBrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giovanelli for three nights in late March and were very pleasantly surprised at the quality, service,position and ambience of the hotel. We were made most welcome on a late arrival Sunday and one of us upgraded. The room had an aroma of cigarette smoke so we drew it to their attention and they fixed it immediately, offering us a 'fresh ' clean or to move rooms. We had no problem thereafter. It's not their fault if the previous occupant had smoked, against the rules. The directions on the web site are 95% accurate, could just do with a short addition that from the waterbus stop the hotel is immediately to the left, over the small bridge. The rooms were modern, good bath / shower. Plenty of hot water. Good continental breakfast, but the most outstanding feature is the staff. Nothing seems too much trouble, concierge patiently explaining everything in good enough English, late barman ensuring we all had a drink before he went home, rooms spotlessly cleaned, reception staff very helpful. When we came to leave on the final day, I said " we need to check out". "Why?" he said. That just about sums it up

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Venice and it was clean, beautiful, great personnel, and an amazing location right off the water bus stop. Easy to get to, cheaper than other hotels closer to the square.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch, fantastic, comfortable and modern”
Reviews.Author: Nick T
Reviews.Content: Everything about Palazzo Giovanelli was top-rate - the staff were courteous and very helpful, the breakfasts were great, the hotel rooms were outstandingly appointed, and the Grand Canal location was just stunning (our view of the Ukranian Biennale pavilion installation next door at night was luminous.) And to echo one of the other reviewers, it's VERY nice to be a >little< off the beaten path and away from the Hordes, BUT the San Stae Vaporetto stop is right outside. Don't hesitate to stay here - it's great!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: BeacheeMe
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice in July. The areas around St. Mark's were packed with tourists -- so many it was sometimes hard to walk. It was also swelteringly hot. This was part of the reason I so loved Palazzo Giovanelli. It's located away from the tourist traffic, in an area where you can wander uncrowded streets and alleys, browse menus at excellent little restaurants, and sit in a piazza with a gelato just watching birds. It made for a completely different experience of the city -- a place where your visual focus is on the buildings and canals and bridges instead of the sight of thousands of sweaty tourists. Palazzo Giovanelli was also very easy to find. I didn't realize how important this was till we arrived in Venice, got off the ferry, and started looking for our hotel. It's right off the San Stae stop, so we dodged a bullet of having to drag our luggage through winding, confusing streets and alleys trying to get our bearings after a long train trip. The hotel itself is really lovely. Our room was small but we were expecting that. The decor was modern and stylish -- very Italian -- with a nice marble bathroom and good-sized tub. The bed was comfortable and everything felt fresh and clean. The in-room Internet had a weak connection. It only worked in certain spots in the room. The public areas of the hotel were small but beautiful. (Definitely explore the upstairs floors to check out the breathtaking Murano glass chandeliers there.) The staff was always helpful and friendly and told us a little about the history of the hotel and Venice. Breakfast was fine. Not the largest selection, but we were satisfied. The lounge area overlooking the Grand Canal was lovely. Sometimes at night we would walk a few steps out the hotel's front door and sit by large huge, stunning art installation at the San Stae stop watching the world go by on the Grand Canal and the lights twinkling off the water. It was perfect. I'm SO glad our AAA travel agent recommended this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and modern”
Reviews.Author: Phylomela
Reviews.Content: We spent romantic weekend there, and celebrated wedding anniversary. Our room was standard at 3rd floor, with small window in bedroom and large window in bath. Bath is very nice and well equipped. Sleeping quality was very good, we had window to small canal and I didn't notice any noise from neighbors. Breakfast was included to price, I liked it, good choice of meal, perfect coffee and crispy italian pastry. Service was friendly. But sometimes people have to wait a little to be seated, especially if they come in late morning. They have comfortable sofas in front of entrance, so you don't need to stay in line. Also I liked yard and garden, very pretty. I'll be glad to stay again there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark_111_222_333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights last month and had a great time. The hotel is in a fantastic location on the grand canal. We didn't pay for the canal view but had a view (just about) of one of the smaller canals along side the hotel, which was nice. The location and the staff were very helpful, It's a touch pricey though but it seemed to be the going rate in Venice. Overall we were very happy with it

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric yes, comfortable no”
Reviews.Author: Discernman
Reviews.Content: Booked a room with a canal view but shown a room with a garden view, so "upgraded" to the Foscarini suite. It smelled of damp and was cold. Apparently the hotel is not allowed by the city of Venice to switch the heating on until it gets to a certain temperature! On complaining got a fan heater but bathroom smelly and very cold so after another complaint got an extension lead so heater could stretch into bathroom, but bedroom not comfortable so asked to be moved. Leave it to us they said we'll fix the heating...and they did but by then 2 days of our holiday had passed uncomfortably...why not before?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paula G
Reviews.Content: Great room overlooking the canal, very clean, quiet and we found the staff to be very friendly and courteous. Nothing was too much trouble, great recommendations for dinner. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara W
Reviews.Content: You must have a suite if you expect an acceptable room and there are silly extra charges such as you must pay for wifi unless you specify it when you make reservation. We didn't experience this anywhere else in Italy. Coffee is excellent though.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: omar a
Reviews.Content: Features: Good location of the hotel, the beauty of the Junior Suite, the cleanliness of the room and bathroom, good treatment of employees and good breakfast Disadvantages: There is no restaurant in hotel for lunch or

Reviews.Title: “FLAWED”
Reviews.Author: holtex
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the third floor. The lift goes to the second floor, then we had to walk from front to back and go up a service staircase to reach our room. Not great. The room had only two small windows at floor level, reaching up to knee level, giving very little light and no view. The Sky box was on the back of the TV, so it did not respond to the remote control. There was no mirror in the room, only in the bathroom, so my wife had to dry hair and apply make-up standing up in the bathroom - impossible if I was in there at the same time. The built-in reading lights on each side of the bed did not work. The only switch that worked anything turned on ELEVEN lights, four of which shine directly down onto the pillows. Imagine turning them on in the middle of the night! I told reception this on the first day and they said they already knew. On the second day I asked them to provide a small lamp on each bedside table, but they did not. They did nothing to address this in the four nights we stayed there. There was a glass door between the bedroom and the en-suite area that was unnecessary and constantly got in the way. It was very easy to walk into. The room, like the rest of the hotel, was neat and tidy and clean. But the design of our room was really poor and unfortunately the management did nothing to try and solve those problems that could have been solved.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* hotel, disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: teeathome
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a very special romantic trip but this hotel was very disappointing. Minuses. We were expecting a superior room with a canal view but that is not what we were given until we complained though and were given a side view but the room was tiny.No restaurant for lunch or dinner. Breakfast was simple and ok more like 3* level though the staff in the dining room were very pleasant.Mildew on the mastic in the bath which I managed to clean off quite easily, curtains that didn't meet then disappeared to reappear as one heavy and one net curtain weird, being told the bar was closing 10 to 11pm on a Saturday evening.A single wardrobe with three small drawers and not full length=creased clothes.Romantic....no not in the room we were given.Would not recommend. Pluses. The hotel is well situated for easy walking and waterbus, which is handy as have to find restaurants for meals. Luckily venice has plenty of very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PortlandQuay
Reviews.Content: We need to declare that we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite during our stay, so our impressions may be influenced by that very pleasant surprise. That said, we still believe this was the best hotel we stayed at during our two week holiday in Italy. Location is fantastic, within easy access to the main attractions, but just as importantly, within easy access to several areas which reflect to true local Vanician Culture and are away from the hoards of tourists. Our only negative was breakfast, we have almost more selection and choice in our kitchen cupboard at home - but that seems to be typical of Italian Hotels. Overall, a great experience in the most enchanting city we have evert visited.

Reviews.Title: “Attic room”
Reviews.Author: rajeev g
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and I must say the location of the hotel is great. I was staying on the top floor and must say the experience was horrible. My sister hit her head like multiple times as the ceilings were way too low. The room hardly has any place and by the end of the first day you start getting a back ache!!! Also the bathroom ceilings were unbelievably low, it was almost impossible to take a shower without banging your head to the wall/ceiling. I wish I had taken some photos for the same. Also the tv in our room didn't even switch on and we asked downstairs multiple times but nobody helped us out. The hotel seems incredibly understaffed. Funny thing is we paid over 300 usd for the room! Now thee good things... the hotel is clean and the location is good! If you get the room on the top I would suggest staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: jimjan69
Reviews.Content: Expensive but worth every penny! we got a junior suite which had wooden beams a massive king sized bed and jacuzzi bath. Rooms were spacious and had 4 windows with a view of the grand canal. A lot of other little luxuries like bath robes were also included. Staff were very helpful and there is a vaparetto (boat bus stop) right next to the hotel which is very useful. Although not located near sites it isnt actually that far a walk from the rialto bridge. A free trip to Marano to see the glass factory is available through the hotel, it is one of those obvious attempts to get you to buy something when youre there, but its worth it just for the boat trip there. Hotel is difficult to find first time, basically head over a little iron railing bridge, then head down the narrowest street ever and your there.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the tall”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler_scr
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure about all of the rooms,but the top floor ceilings are so low that I hit my head on in during the night. The elevator also does not go all the way to the 5th floor. Our friends staying there at the same time did complain (the shower head came to his chest) and they did give him an upgraded room that did seem more appropriately positioned for the "average american". The breakfast included did include hot items and assorted juices. Nothing extravagant, but nice. A word on the "free" trip to Murano - nothing's really free. The boat ride over is great but you're greeted at the dock by a representative from the factor for a sales tour. There was a wait to get a boat back and it was not a private ride nor are you taken back to the hotel where you were picked up. In the spirit of full disclosure, I stayed at a larger hotel in an incredible room the nights before so my expectations may have been unrealistic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: MaryBUSA
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel to end our two week Italian Vacation. We started out in Rome to Tuscany to Florence and we were exhausted by the time we arrived in Venice. The staff was cheerful, accommodating and went beyond our expectations with service and surprises!!! Easy access to the main attractions yet in a pocket of seclusion from the main crowds giving us the true Venetian experience we had hoped for during our stay. Great dining within a 2 minute stroll. Special Thanks to Domenico Fort and his team whom made our stay in Venice a memory of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “So many positives, but one huge negative!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_6282
Reviews.Content: The hotel is everything you could want in Venice, situation is perfect, on the Grande Canal, right next to the vaporetto stop San Stae, and beautiful intertiors in rich colours. The breakfast is minimal, but fresh, tasty and sufficient. The room was a fabulous size, and very beautifully decorated. The only issue, and it was a big one...was that we had a disabled access room, and the bathroom is a COMPLETE nightmare! There is no shower doors, or even a shower curtain. One shower and everything is soaked: from the towels to the toilet seat...and even the toilet paper! The bathroom is literally unusable after 1 shower. If we had stayed longer, I would have definately gone insane. This one big fault of the hotel makes me give it 3 stars out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Very excellent hotel..with very high standards”
Reviews.Author: Willowhisper
Reviews.Content: A lovely appointed hotel on the Grand Canal in Venice. Unlike others of similar price this hotel is of extremely high standard and very clean...lovely location. The staff are very friendly and very efficient. Helpful, and well dressed and presented as well as any *5 star and above. Although this hotel is *star, this is only due to the lack of the 'extra's like swimming pool/gym etc...If you want a quiet but elegant place to stay in the middle of everything yet very peaceful and exclusively placed.. this is the one. The bar is located in the main foyer as is the reception and the jetty is just behind the bar where on can have lovely views of the Grand Canal while having a pre dinner drink. I cannot fault this hotel, and I have been brought up in the 'the business' and am therefor very fussy when on vacation. On reading another review of this establishment, the only negative thing that could be said by others was the lack of tea nad coffee making facilities.. I must stae that in defence of the Hotel's policy, Venice has very strict fire regulations because of the nature of the place and the preciousness of the architecture and history that need to be protected.. this is a natural and obvious precaution. You will also not be able to get an iron in your room either, but housekeeping will take care of any ironing.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant modern blended with gorgeous old palazzo - overlooking Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: SallyGreenwichCT
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Palazzo Giiovanelli with 6 of us -- 4 teens + parents in 2 adjoining triple rooms. accommodations were comfortable; large, modern bathrooms, beamed ceilings in each room -- great character. beds were comfortable. staff was sharp, polite & helpful. best parts of the hotel were: walkway out back lobby directly onto platform overlooking Grand Canal & old, historic part of 'palazzo' with stone architecture, ornate Venetian chandeliers, and massive common rooms. wonderful contrast with the clean, modern style of the lobby. easier to find in Venice than other hotels, as it is ON the Grand Canal, not tucked into back neighborhood! very romantic if you are traveling without kids...

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous palazzo experience”
Reviews.Author: Rockgenie19
Reviews.Content: If you're the kind of person who loves the romantic idea of staying in a 16th century palazzo in Venice, this hotel totally delivers. It fronts directly onto the Graned Canal and inside you can see beautiful chandeliers and frescoes. So that's the atmosphere taken care of. The service was also great - we were blown away to find the staff had upgraded us to the junior suite (that's the one in the photos with the beams and giant four-poster bed). The room also included a large bathroom with a jacuzzi bath and a big balcony looking onto the garden. We did check out the other rooms, and while they wereh definitely small in comparison, they were pretty, and not at all like a faceless corporate hotel. The breakfast was also good, with a variety of cereal, ham, yoghurt and continental pastries. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, to the extent that they would offer to guide guests where they wanted to go. I appreciated this, as when you arrive in Venice, you discover that its reputatiotn for getting you lost is fully deserved - it's a mass of tiny, winding streets. The hotel itself is pretty easy to locate - if you're coming from the train station, or the airport via the bus station, you take vaporetto 1 to San Stae, and the hotel is just next to the stop. Finding the way in was a bit tricky the first time. But it was reassuring to know that we could pick up our bags and be at the station within 20 minutes. At the same time, we were walking distance from some major landmarks, like St Mark's Square and the Rialto bridge. Just next door is the Ca' Pesaro, which houses the International Gallery of Modern Art.

Reviews.Title: “Restored Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Photozenic
Reviews.Content: After researching numerous hotels for our 2nd trip to Rome, I was so glad that I came across Palazzo Giovanelli. The hotel has been restored in an old Venetian building, and what results are amazing modern touches matched against old world Italy. My husband and I stayed in the junior suite overlooking the Grand Canal and we were impressed by the rooms size, the modern bathroom and the fabulous views. The complimentary breakfast was good (included scrambled eggs, various croissants, and as much cappuccinos as one desires) and allowed us to start the day on a hearty note, while exploring Venice. The only improvements I would suggest are, for such a large suite, the bathroom is small comparatively. It would have made more sense to have a larger bathroom with 2 sinks since the junior suite will most probably house multiple people. We also had a couple of problems with the water pressure going in and out in the early evenings. These were minor issues that would be good to suggest to the front desk if you experience them, but overall we were happy with our choice and would stay at the Palazzo again. Pros: Location/Grand Canal Views, Complimentary Breakfast, Modern Appointments without losing Venetian "Old World Feel" Cons: Relatively small bathroom in junior suite, shower water pressure inconsistent

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: NewChapter036
Reviews.Content: We stayed two wonderful nights at this hotel. At our arrival, we had a big surprise: they had upgraded us from superior room to Presidential suite at no cost! Obviously, the room was even nicer than we expected, with a huge salon, canal views, nice modern bathroom, comfortable beds. Although this was one of the nicer suites, I'm pretty sure the same attention to quality is given to all the rooms in the hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful, and had a great sense of humor. The breakfast was varied and plentiful. The hotel is well located next to a Vaporetto and airport shuttle stop. We would stay there again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful centrally located”
Reviews.Author: shossain6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely charming! we stayed in May for 5 nights for our honeymoon. Everything about the hotel was wonderful starting from the front desk. Only thing I would say is that rooms are a little smaller than what I expected from seeing the picture but it wasn't a big deal. We loved the neighborhood also it was close enough to all major tourist stuff but yet quiet. There were some great restauarnts also 2-3 blocks away. If we visit Venice again we will def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: happydays2705
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May. We arrived by water taxi from Marco Polo Airport & it cost us â‚¬100. It was well worth it as it got our weekend off to a terrific start. The hotel only opened in 2010 & was very nicely decorated throughout. An old historic building which has been given a very tastefull makeover. Our room was perfect for a weekend stay & staff couldn't have been more helpfull. The only possible negative comment would be the breakfast which didn't live up to the high standard of the hotel. The vaporetto stop is next to the hotel & is a good guide if you loose your bearings. Lots of bars & restaurants in the locality & it was very nice to wander around the quiet streets in the evening. If we come back to Venice we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed in in all of ITALY”
Reviews.Author: backtee2
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but by far this hotel needs to be considered if your in Venice! Very up to date and right on the waterway..can catch a water taxi out the front door. Great looking "gem" ..a little hard to find with the hidden walkways but when I go back to Venice this is were I will stay!!! Be careful of the little "game the hotel front desk plays with the free class blowing tour of Murano island..they will take you there at no charge in a water taxi but when you get there and see the MASTER work the glass your are very pressured to BUY somthing and none of anything there is in a budget price. Very awkward to tell the plant mgr. you do not intend to buy anything!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: IanB1892
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights between 4th and 8th April. To be honest wasn't my first choice but had available room at short notice. Was very very pleased when we arrived at how wonderful the hotel was. Pictures do not do it justice, it really is in a stunning location. The staff were very helpful and made our stay truely memorable. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice memories”
Reviews.Author: harmonyseeker
Reviews.Content: As I said before the hotel is in a very good location in Venice. Just 50 meters from the vaporetto station San Stae. In Venice it is very important travelling with luggages. Being on the Grand Canal the hotel has an own jetty, so you can arrive with water taxi. The hotel has a relaxed atmosphere. We had a junior suite for 6 nights. The bed was fabulous, big and comfortable. We admired the high ceilings and beautiful murano chandaliers. The hotel is very clean. The smaller rooms are also pretty. The hotel staff was very nice in every way. A big thanks to Pierluca and Jacoppo and Viviana (breakfast). I have to congratulate also to the General Manager for his excellent customer service attitude. Thanks - we enjoyed it very much

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: judymDurham
Reviews.Content: Hotel is easily accessible via vaporetta - great service including free taxi trip to Murano. Breakfast good and room very comfortable and clean. Only drawback from this trip was the horrendous experience of flying from Treviso airport. Please note it took 90 minutes to move 10 feet in the checkput scrum - only made flight by running to Ryanair desk to request help. Anyone flying from this airport do so at your peril!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel depending what room you get ......”
Reviews.Author: Trueam
Reviews.Content: Really pleased we picked this hotel as it is in a good area with affordable restaurants and bars near by, and very easy to get to from the airport. Our room (102) was fine, a bit on the small side but like other people have mentioned we had booked a superior room, but it looked nothing like the rooms on the hotels web site more like the standard room, and it over looked the courtyard/entrance. My only complaint was the bathroom it was for disabled use so there was no bath and the shower had no shower screen or curtain so the bathroom floor was always flooded, there was no shelf to put any thing and lots of grab rails over the walls. We were only there for 4 days but any longer it would have driven me mad. Breakfast was fine but one morning the service was not what it should have been, and we had to ask for things to be replenished. We had a drink in the bar one night but we were the only ones there so there was no atmosphere. Venice is a lovely city and easy to get around I'm really pleased I've been.

Reviews.Title: “If you book on their website, be sure of your exact dates - no refunds will be given.”
Reviews.Author: Paulettte
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is very beautiful, the staff was not nearly as attentive as were the staff in other hotels in Italy - the Hotel Brittania in Rome, for instance, which was fabulous. For example, I was in the hotel's ladies room when the lights went out ( I guess they were on a motion detector!) , leaving me in absolute total darkness. Rediculous! I then spilled my glass of water, breaking the glass while fumbling around trying to get myself together and find the door to get out. When I told the help behind the desk, the gentleman was not concerned at all that I had a bad experience, and seemed only concerned about the fixtures in the hotel. Also, when you book on their website, be absolutely sure that you will be able to stay the exact dates that you book - I became ill and arrived a day late - even though I called 48 hours ahead of time to cancel, my credit card was billed for the extra night that I missed.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Comfort - what more?”
Reviews.Author: Sheridan_Iluka
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice in August 2010.Location is great with easy access to the canal transport or just to walk around. Some nice and peaceful restaurants nearby. Rooms were modern and very clean and serviced that way. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Good breakfast by Italian Standards. They even arranged a free taxi to Murano which was a great trip but take limited cash to the Glass factories as they are pressure sellers. There is an old saying if you are are on to a good thing stick to it. If they keep up their standards we will be their regulars.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice friendly hotel would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: R8TGO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 4 star and an old House converted and recently renovated to a high standard, we really enjoyed our stay and our rooom had super high ceilings with origonal wooden beams. The waterbus stop was next to the hotel so made our week of exploring so much easier. What surprised us most was the area the hotel is situated in has the best restaurants and cafe's all within easy walking distance from the Hotel. The restaurants really worth a visit include La Zucca (which was the best restaurant we visited in our weeks holiday) another good restaurant is MuroVenezia San Stae. We also found a one man bar very close which had a great atmosphere and catered for locals so we got a real feel for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but be careful with room allocation”
Reviews.Author: Laranjinha77
Reviews.Content: It's a fantastic property but the rooms shown on the website are misleading. We paid for a junior suite and hoped to get one of the rooms featured on the website. Instead we were allocated a room which according to the hotel website is only a superior room. When I raised this with the receptionist he informed me that it must be a mistake on their website. When I look at their site now, the very room which I stayed in features as a superior room - not junior suite which is what the hotel claimed it was.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - if a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: sloopy66
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel in a lovely situation on the Grand Canal; but don't expect a Grand Canal view. Our very spacious room overlooked the side canal and was the more interesting for it. Immediate neighbour is San Stae church. Served by San Stae vaporetto (Line 1 only), the Hotel is a 2 minute walk away. The staff are very helpful and willing to get information for you. Breakfast was a little disappointing - the usual fare. But it's a minor quibble. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, well appointed hotel at a very reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: WorldCitizen946
Reviews.Content: We came across this hotel at the last moment. We were very happy with the service we received. The rooms were lovely, and when we arrived the staff were happy to show us a few different rooms for us to choose from. They were helpful is all respects of our stay here. The breakfast was also good, with most things (American style buffet). The hotel is on the Grand Canal and is right next to a vaparetto stop (however, I would skip the very overpriced boats and enjoy getting lost in the streets of Venice, with the main attractions never being more than a leisurely 15 min walk). Also, internet prices (wireless) was very very reasonable, with a 10 euro flat rate for your stay. The internet cafes around Venice are upwards of 8 euro for one hour of browsing. If this is within your price range, don't bother looking further, this is very good value for Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location great views”
Reviews.Author: bethtompkins2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. It is right on the Grand Canal and right next to the vaporetto stop. We had a junior suite with a huge king-sized bed and an enormous bathroom. The staff at the front desk were very helpful in making reservations and recommendations for restaurants and things to do. One of the best restaurants in Venice (Da Fiore) is a short walk from the hotel. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little gem”
Reviews.Author: Baliaddict
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to find right next to San stae stop so perfect for getting around. Rooms are lovely and beds very comfortable . Staff could not be more friendly went out of way to help .maximi (sorry if not Spelt correctly ) was wonderful, full of knowledge and always ready with a big smile she is a credit to the staff there . Yes breakfast could be better but it's adequate. Would definitely recommend this hotel. So much cheaper around here and c ar doro stop to eat than closer into the city! The Internet in the hotel is good value if you are staying a few days 10 euros for your stay. Remember as well in the bars / cafes there are 2 different prices - one for standing and nearly double for sitting!! Enjoy Venice it is a truly different city, fanastic shops and great wine !

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay in an elegant bijou hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesBrian037
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this holel as part of our diamond wedding celebrations. From the warm greetings we received at the reception desk on our arrival until we left, we found the service friendly and efficient. Our standard room on the second floor was high-ceilinged and spacious; the beds and chairs were comfortable and everything was spotless. We had no view of the canal but we did overlook the garden. Our bathroom was beautifully fitted and the toileteries first class. Breakfasts were substantial with a wide variety of choice. Because of the self-service arrangement, those guests who wanted to shoot off sightseeing could do so; for those of us who preferred a more leisurely breakfast, there was no sense of being pressured to make room for others The hotel was very conveniently situated for travelling by vaporetto or for setting off exploring on foot. All the major attractions were within comfortable walking distance. Over the years we have been fortunate enough to stay in many four (and five) star hotels,. In our view, this hotel compares very favourably with the best of them. We unreservedy recommend Palazzo Giovanellito to those who appreciate that intimacy and sense of personal service which is very rarely be found in larger hotels. We hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, and good value”
Reviews.Author: luizaqueroga
Reviews.Content: I've booked this hotel for one night during my second time in Venice, and I didn't get disappointed. The hotel was great, and rooms incredible comfortable and finely furnished and decorated, and the bathroom was really beautiful. It was really cheap, and I've booked with less then 24h advance. The breakfast as not bad, but it could have more options. And the staff is helpful and well trained, but they don't smile at all. These were the only bad points. We got a simple room, with no gorgeous view like the others, better then ours, but it was really good, I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Scunneredbywork
Reviews.Content: What can I say, Venice is exactly what everyone said it would be & staying at the Palazzo Giovanelli just made it even better. It couldn't be easier to get to. Number 1 vaparetto (that's 1 not 2 as we did but never mind we had an early look at the Rialto Bridge!), get off at San Stae, then cross the wee bridge over the canal to the left & walk up the covered walkway, turn left & the hotel entrance is just along the path with the bouncey boards. The front desk staff were charming & courteous & we were taken straight up to our room when we arrived just after midday. We had got a good deal through Octopus Travel which specified that there would be no view. We couldn't have been happier when we saw room 104 with a view on to the San Stae Canal from one window and if you opened the other window & looked to the right, there was the Gran Canal. The room itself was lovely, with touches of traditional Venice like the red fabric on the wall & the wooden beamed roofs but modern lighting and a nice marble bathroom. We had a slight problem with our airconditioning with the room being 2 hot but this was sorted out then monitored by the front desk. The breakfast room was small but bright & modern, with a decent selection of the usual cold food, cereals etc as well as a hot container with bacon & eggs. The staff were again very polite & kept everyting replenished & if you need another cup of coffee then you only have to ask. We also had a drink at the bar one night, which was lovely to sit looking towards the doors to the waterside entrance. At night we found there were plenty of reasonably priced places to eat within an easy 5 minute walk of the hotel. After that if we felt like another drink we just hopped back on the Vaparetto then down to Rialto Market where there were a few bars. We also drank in a bar with amazing wine that was over the bridge then up the street and to the left but I'm afraid I can't remember the name. The guy behind the bar knew his stuff! I really can't say enough good things about the hotel. I think I must have looked at every hotel & B & B in Venice before we booked so many had dark & overbearing decor or they were too expensive or out of the way, I was really starting to think I would never find my Venice Hotel but I'm happy to say Palazzo Giovanelli was it for me. I know people say you only sleep in your room but coming back to a nice hotel can make a good trip even better. I would also recommend buying the transport pass through Venice Connected. We were there for 3 days so we bought the 72 hour pass but got the blue bus that cost 3 Euros from the airport then got our actual tickets when we got to Piazale Roma. This meant we then had our full 72 hours use on the vaparetto then got the city 5D bus back to the airport for our flight home. Because we bought them more that 7 days before we also got them for 28.05 instead of 33.00 euros. We purchased internet acess through them too which worked out at 8.00 euros. Mostly worked best near the vaparetto stops but we got it working at the waterside entrance to the hotel & up the main starcase at the arched windows!! All in all a fab stay in Venice (even on a rainy Sunday) and a fab stay at Palazzo Giovanelli.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Botique Hotel Close to Public Transportation”
Reviews.Author: BOTTP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here and It was our first visit to Venice. Front desk personnel were very helpful and multi-lingual. Answered our questions regarding use of public transportation vs. water taxis, maps, restaurant recommendations and banks. Also provided us with a good map. We found the room to be small but workable. Modern quiet and clean best describes the room with a beautiful view of a small canal off the back of the hotel and the Grand Canal in front. Excellent breakfast included. Very small bar area but we ordered drinks a couple times and sat out on the dock watching all the action on the Grand Canal. Having a water bus stop next to the hotel was a bonus and made exploring Venice easy. We would definately recommend this hotel to friends and hope to return someday. The two things I'd like the hotel to consider adding is washclothes in the rooms and chairs out on the dock.

Reviews.Title: “What a Waste!”
Reviews.Author: Ranaya12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as part of our European honeymoon. It was by far the worst hotel we stayed in. Let me start by saying that the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are clean and the food was not bad. Our biggest problem with the hotel was the staff and the service provided. When we arrived we were NOT greeted warmly. The gentleman behind the desk just asked for our name and didn't say a word until he had our room key in his hand, went around the desk and told us to follow him to the room. No map of the area was ever offered (I had to later request one), no information was provided regarding the breakfast hours or where the breakfast was being served. We had to figure all this out on our own. The worst part was when we returned from sightseeing one afternoon to find our bedroom door open with two construction guys working in the room, tool and dust everywhere! We went to the front desk and asked what was going on and no apology was offered. The same guy from check-in said, "This is a construction day, they are doing it in all the rooms". I told him they should have notified us that this was going to happen, and again just a shrug and no apology! For the amount of money we paid to stay here we expected way better service. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: 2Josgo
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! The location is great for sight-seeing, the daily breakfast is yummy, the customer service is great and the front desk staff are multi-lingual. There is only one sign to hotel so it is easy to walk pass. The hotel is easy to get to from the Grand Canal Ste Stae boat stop (ACTV boat). Facing the Church cross the foot bridge on your left hand side and take the first left down (an alley) and first left again....you're at the entrance!

Reviews.Title: “fantastically located Palazzo right on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: travelaussiefamily
Reviews.Content: Located next to the San Stae stop for the vaporetto (water bus), between the Santa Maris railway station and Piazza San Marco. An easy walk to Rialto Bridge. We stayed in the Mozart suite, which had plenty of space (maybe 90+ sqm). incredibly high ceilings.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: SJBPalmCity
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. I booked a dormer room and upon arrival they gave me a room that the ceiling is only 4 foot tall on one side. And the room is only 15x15. So, at least half of the room you cannot walk in. We are not tall people and we have to duck down to walk through the room. We asked for another room, and they said we could either upgrade to a much more expensive room (we had already paid over 300 per night) or we could just leave. The manager said if we did not like the room leave, but he would not refund our money. It was not a matter of not liking the room, WE COULD NOT STAND UP IN IT. It was ridiculous, The manager was extremely rude and then informed us that he was the owner. The hotel is not in a very good location either. I would definately not recommend this hotel. The only other room we saw while there was the size of a closet.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and quiet at the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: BaenschMi
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is a very nice restaurated old Venezian Palazzo directly at the Grand Canal. ItÂ´s a more quiet area while only minutes walk away from the busy Rialto area. You can reach this 4 star hotel easily by waterbus / St. Stae station. We were staying for a week and the only we missed was the barservice coming home after 10 pm, but there are plenty of places nearby. Strongly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Think again - Antiche Figure here we come next time!”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller
Reviews.Content: At first glance a very sleek renovation of a Palazzo on the Grand Canal. Hard to argue with the great location. However, we felt it was an example of style over substance Room 503 - at the top of the building with a dormer window that (if you stood on a chair you could see te Grand Canal). The room wasn't inviting, but was clean. Lovely bedding although my wife felt the bed was too hard.However, we did feel a little neglected there and disconnected from the rest of the hotel - no toiletries replaced until we asked for them on our third day, and when the blind from our dormer window fell off, it wasn't repaired, just taken away leaving us with a sky view overnight that woke us up at dawn! There is a step just inside the room and another just outside the room, which when you take the electronic room key and the lights go out, you cannot see either! At the foot of the stairs up to our room ,we found various bags of laundry, mops , a cart at one time which is clearly evidence of cleaning, just dumped at the bottom of our stairs... Not really what you would expect Front of house: really good (except for the quite creepy older man who did little in the way of eye contact and never said a word to us in three days). The guy who took our bags was great though, and seemed to be the only one with a genuine smile - unlike the breakfast staff...Other reviewers have commented about the quality of the breakfast, and I cannot disagree with them, however the whole breakfast staff were poor beyond belief. The guy in charge was fantastic at avoiding eye contact, and seemed to argue with the woman (who gave as good as she got to be fair) at every opportunity. The arguing could be heard in the main breakfast room and on one occasion could be watched by all and sundry as the kitchen door was left open! Poor! One coffee did seem to be the limit - although I did push the boat out on my last morning and asked for another! Cannot see a circumstance under which we will be back - there are so many better hotels than this one, and full price is definitely overpriced

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful, extravagant, fantastic hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: AuntyJan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself stayed here from the 9th to the 12th of August 2010 as part of a Railbookers holiday. The hotel is absolutely spectacular, the staff are amazing and so polite and eager to help in any way. Our suite was pristine and made us feel like royality. The breakfasts offered plenty of variety and set us both up for the day. We hired a gondola which picked us up from the hotels very own private jetty. We were also provided with a private motorboat, free of charge, to take us to the island of Murano. If you buy a piece of Murano, no matter what the cost, the Murano factory provide a free motorboat return journey back to the Rialto. I cannot fault this hotel in any way, we were so well cared for and treat like one of their family and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, hidden gem of Venice”
Reviews.Author: ExprncdTrvler3333
Reviews.Content: I just recently got back from a stay at the Palazzo Giovanelli. I was a little apprehensive booking it because there were not many reviews and I had a hard time finding out any information or pictures of this hotel other than what was on their website. The hotel itself was amazing. It is an old palazzo that has recently been completely renovated. It is all new and modern yet still manages to give a Venetian feel. This was really refreshing to find since MANY of the other hotels in this price range in Venice seem like they haven't been renovated in 25+ years. It is directly on the Grand Canal waterfront and is 2 Vaporetto stops from the train/bus station. The station is right in front of this hotel or if you use a private boat you can pull up right to the hotels private dock. This hotel is not directly in main part of Venice (which is a good thing to get out of the crowds) and it is a beautiful 10-20 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and St Marks areas. Since I was traveling on a budget I booked a Room with a dormer (which are smaller rooms located in the renovated attic part of the hotel on the 5th floor) that were around $150/night. I am assuming they are much smaller than the other rooms at the hotel and only have a small dormer window to look out. The room was actually to my surprise spacious, clean, and very comfortable with two chairs, a desk, a comfortable bed, a hallway area/closet to put our luggage, and a good size bathroom. The only downside of these rooms was that they are so close to the roof you have to bend over in certain parts of the room. If I were going to spend more money or stay longer than 2-3 days I would get a more upgraded room. Im sure many of them have amazing views of the canal. I would definitely stay here again given the price range. Even the nicer rooms were VERY reasonably priced for this city. Whenever I make it back I will definitely consider this hotel but I am sure once this hotel gets its name out there it will become significantly more expensive. Overall I was very happy! Friendly staff that all spoke English. Free wifi-internet. Satellite TV of some kind with many channels (even in English), the breakfast for us was included but it was a good selection of muffins, pastries, eggs, juices, yogurts, cereal, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up! Beautiful brand new hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mirai10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Palazzo Giovanelli for our honeymoon and it was a great choice! We had wonderful help from the front desk for reserving restaurants and gondola rides; they even prepared a bottle of wine to go on the gondola, which was so romantic! The room was spotless clean and the lobby is a beautiful open space. The location is perfect as it is in a very quiet and charming quarter of venice, yet very convenient to get to every where! Our room had a view over a lovely garden- I would say almost better than the canal view as it is very quiet and quaint-l ike a secret garden in the labyrinth of Venice. I would love to come back to the Palazzo for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Find!”
Reviews.Author: Li2nPa2
Reviews.Content: PROs * Super location on Grand Canal and literally right next to a vaporetto (water bus) stop! * Close enough by water bus to everything you want to get to (3 stops to the Rialto) but still quiet. The other hotels we considered close to San Marco might have been just too much in the midst of the madness for us! this was perfect * Decor preserves the charm of Venice while being modern. This is a tough balance to achieve. Some hotels are either too designer or then suffocatingly ornate... * Value for money in Venice! We struggled a lot last min to find something and were lucky to come across this place CONs Lousy breakfast, especially for vegetarians!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palazzo Giovanelli
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce, San Stae, 2070, 30135 Venice, Italy
